definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
to slander/to defame/to speak ill of

sentences.english: The most feared punishment is the defamation lawsuit which can result in permanent financial ruin.
sentences.chinese: 最令人惧怕的是会造成永久破财的毁谤官司。

sentences.english: 16 at the taunts of those who reproach and revile me, because of the enemy, who is bent on revenge.
sentences.chinese: 都因那辱骂毁谤人的声音，又因仇敌和报仇人的缘故。

sentences.english: People were slandering a good man, that she knew.
sentences.chinese: 人家常常要毁谤好人，那是她知道的。

sentences.english: Burning in fires of a slanderous tongue.
sentences.chinese: 在一条毁谤之舌的毒焰中焚烧。

sentences.english: They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
sentences.chinese: 他们的口亵渎上天，他们的舌毁谤全地。

sentences.english: For if I by grace be a partaker, why am I evil spoken of for that for which I give thanks?
sentences.chinese: 我若谢恩而吃，为什么因我谢恩的物被人毁谤呢。

sentences.english: Contentions and disputes are linked with selfishness, and slander is born of contention.
sentences.chinese: 争吵和争论与妒忌相连，伴随争论产生毁谤。

sentences.english: Presumptuous are they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.
sentences.chinese: 他们胆大任性，毁谤在尊位的也不知惧怕。

sentences.english: Silence gives a best answer for durning.
sentences.chinese: 沉默是毁谤最好的答复。

sentences.english: Kick me, kike me, don't you wrong or right me.
sentences.chinese: 踢打我，毁谤我，你不能颠倒我的是非。

sentences.english: But, wink, wink, the damage is done.
sentences.chinese: 但是，眨眼间，毁谤已经造成了。

definition: variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to start rumours and create trouble
to frame/to bring false charges against
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
